description.narrative: Improved capacity of institutions, communities and families to support an protect children, which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, Botswana fully implements policies and programmes towards the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals and targets and national aspirations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved capacity of institutions, communities and families to support an protect children

description.narrative: UNICEF and the Government of Botswana undertook a system strengthening based intervention and is conducting a gap analysis and mapping exercise for the social services workforce. It also embarked on a nation-wide Campaign, under the banner “E Seng Mo Ngwaneng” on the prevention of sexual exploitation and abuse, engaging Government counterparts, non-Government partners, communities and the private sector, and bringing unprecedented attention to the issue | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:17/01/2020

title.narrative: Percentage of districts that have a free and universal birth registration service within the civil registration (in accordance with national legal requirements)
Child Protection system has both preventive and responsive services available and there is a framework for coordination
The quality assurance system for social work meets defined standards for normative framework, system of supervision and support, licensing/accreditation, and data collection systems
Existence of a free and universal birth registration service within the civil registration in accordance with national legal requirements
